column4: Does it just not mount, or does it give you permissions trouble?
Pun, weird.  Is it NTFS or FAT?
Anybody know if the default kernel includes NTFS read right now?
Eh, I'm pretty sure it does anyway or that volume wouldn't have worked.
Pun: Are any of the other partitions NTFS?
(this actually isn't why I don't use NTFS any more, but it's part of the reason I won't in the future)
Pun: I assume it's because you want to access it ;p
Troubleshooting is fun, I tell you!
Pun: I suppose there's no chance you can copy everything off the partition, format it as FAT, and replace the files? :p
In my experience, rebooting in windows is less painful than using wine, in most situations
I need to use it to be able to use my network adapter software on ubuntu ;)
You might try looking for a debian package on the internet
some recent-ish-looking dpkgs are here: http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/archive/index.html
Thanks but arren fixed it :)
if it's as good as the speach recognition software, it'll take five hours to get working, and understand a word one time out of five.
Ha, remember that PS2 game where you controlled the girl with your voice?
Strip nude! I will not do that! Get naked! I will not do that! Shoot zombie! I'm sorry, I don't understand.
I actually have never heard of it, but it sounds amusing
It's kind of funny, you can tell her "Dance" and she dances, she only recognizes dumb commands, not practical ones
One wonders if something could be arranged with some text-to-speech software set on repeat
I think if you use 'sudo bash' the terminal will start a terminal in which you are root
it's usually better to use 'sudo [command] ' on a per-command basis though.  If that's what you're asking.
